channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: 'Rohl jumps from Wednesday frying pan into Rangers furnace'
item.description: Danny Rohl has taken on one of the toughest managerial jobs in world football by succeeding Russell Martin at Rangers, writes Tom English.

item.title: Maccabi Tel Aviv will not accept Villa tickets
item.description: Israeli club Maccabi Tel Aviv say they will not accept any ticket allocation from Aston Villa should the decision to ban their supporters from next month's Europa League match be overturned.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: 'Bigger than football' - how Mjallby gatecrashed Sweden's elite
item.description: Mjallby AIF almost went bust nine years ago, but now they have won the Swedish Allsvenskan. BBC Sport analyses their rise.

item.title: Forest in advanced talks to appoint Dyche
item.description: Nottingham Forest are in advanced talks to appoint Sean Dyche as their manager - would he be a more natural fit at the City Ground?

item.title: 'Humbled but inspired' - Potter named Sweden boss
item.description: Former West Ham manager Graham Potter is named as the new head coach of Sweden.

item.title: Man Utd want Sporting's Hjulmand - Tuesday's gossip
item.description: Manchester United target Morten Hjulmand to strengthen their midfield, Marc Guehi is wanted by Barcelona and Real Madrid, plus more.

item.title: Son of ex-England defender Pearce dies in tractor crash
item.description: Harley Pearce died after his tractor crashed in Gloucestershire last week.

item.title: Barca boss Flick to change behaviour 'for grandchildren'
item.description: Barcelona manager Hansi Flick says he does not want his grandchildren to see the behaviour which earned him a red card against Girona on Saturday.

item.title: Mourinho is a visionary - Howe
item.description: Newcastle manager Eddie Howe says Benfica boss Jose Mourinho is a "visionary" as they prepare to meet in the Champions League.

item.title: Brentford dominate West Ham to earn first away win of season
item.description: Brentford earn their first Premier League away win of the season to ruin Nuno Espirito Santo's first home game in charge of struggling West Ham.

item.title: Andrews delighted by 'excellent' Brentford's 'chemistry'
item.description: Brentford boss Keith Andrews is delighted with the "excellent" performance his side put in as they comfortably beat West Ham 2-0 and is pleased with the "chemistry" the Bees are building.

item.title: It was a tough night for West Ham - Nuno
item.description: Nuno Espirito Santo admits it was a tough night for all involved with West Ham following their 2-0 defeat by Brentford at London Stadium.

item.title: Maguire heads Man Utd to victory against Liverpool
item.description: Harry Maguire heads Manchester United to a 2-1 win against Liverpool - their first victory at Anfield since 2016.

item.title: Goal of the season contender? MOTD pundits on 'world-class' Buendia
item.description: Match of the Day pundit and ex-Aston Villa goalkeeper Shay Given describes Emiliano Buendia's winning goal in Villa's 2-1 win over Tottenham in the Premier League as "world class".

item.title: How 'dominant' Maguire helped Man Utd beat Liverpool
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given analyses Harry Maguire's dominance in Manchester United's 2-1 win over Liverpool in the Premier League.

item.title: What football can learn from NFL's international games
item.description: With La Liga and Serie A set to stage regular-season matches overseas, how successful have the NFL's international games been, and what do players and fans think of them?

item.title: Outstanding Simeone would succeed anywhere - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta speaks of his admiration for Atletico Madrid boss Diego Simeone before the two sides meet in the Champions League on Tuesday.

item.title: Rangers end head coach search by appointing Rohl
item.description: Danny Rohl says it is "a huge privilege" to be named Rangers manager and that he is ready to embrace the "huge expectations" of the club's fans.

item.title: Amorim's big moment - are Man Utd finally ready for lift off?
item.description: Finally, at Anfield, home of Manchester United's - historically and statistically - biggest rivals, Ruben Amorim's team delivered a statement win.

item.title: Isak doesn't deserve start over Ekitike - Rooney
item.description: British-record signing Alexander Isak is doing enough to justify starting ahead of Hugo Ekitike for Liverpool, says former England striker Wayne Rooney.

item.title: 'A little Magpie' - why Mourinho 'loves' Newcastle
item.description: Jose Mourinho's Benfica face Newcastle in the Champions League on Tuesday - but why does the Portuguese boss consider himself "a little Magpie"?

item.title: 'Liverpool blip now becomes something deeper'
item.description: The problems are piling up for Liverpool head coach Arne Slot as Manchester United inflict their fourth successive loss, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: Concacaf members join USA's 2031 World Cup bid
item.description: Mexico, Costa Rica and Jamaica join the United States' bid to stage the Women's World Cup in 2031 and are set to host matches at the tournament.

item.title: Liverpool defender Fisk replaces Reid in England squad
item.description: Liverpool defender Grace Fisk is called into the England squad following the withdrawal of Arsenal's Katie Reid.

item.title: Everton defender Branthwaite to have operation
item.description: Everton defender Jarrad Branthwaite needs an operation on an injured hamstring and is set for an extended spell on the sidelines.

item.title: What awaits new Rangers manager Rohl?
item.description: BBC Scotland looks at what needs to be fixed at Rangers after Danny Rohl's appointment.

item.title: Savage wants action on 'vile abuse' directed at him
item.description: Forest Green Rovers boss Robbie Savage says more action needs to be taken against "vile abuse" he has suffered from opposition fans.

item.title: More players stand still as La Liga protests continue
item.description: Players refuse to move for the first 15 seconds of matches in La Liga on Saturday as protests at the Spanish league's decision to stage a game in Miami continued.

item.title: Discrimination row an unwanted distraction - Ward
item.description: Republic of Ireland boss Carla Ward says that the quicker "outside noise" surrounding the Football Association Ireland [FAI] is eradicated the better.

item.title: Morocco look to build on first U20 World Cup title
item.description: Morocco want to be a "strong contender" at all levels of global football after beating Argentina to win the Under-20 World Cup for the first time.

item.title: Bouncy balls, points gaps & Honda Civics - inside Celtic's dismal day
item.description: BBC Scotland examines what was a day of incident for defending Scottish champions Celtic at Dundee.

item.title: 'I wanted to show everyone' - Villa's comeback star Buendia
item.description: Emiliano Buendia is rediscovering his form from three years ago - and scored the winner for Aston Villa against Tottenham.

item.title: No pressure on NI for Iceland play-off - Andrews
item.description: Northern Ireland midfielder Joely Andrews insists "there's no pressure" as the team prepare for their Nations League play-off against Iceland.

item.title: Non-league match abandoned after fans and players brawl
item.description: The game between Avro and Kidsgrove Athletic was abandoned in the 84th minute, says the Oldham club.

item.title: Ex-Real Madrid & Everton winger Drenthe suffers stroke
item.description: Former Real Madrid and Everton winger Royston Drenthe is in hospital after suffering a stroke.

item.title: Why Liverpool are feeling effects of Trent-shaped gap
item.description: BBC Sport analyses what Liverpool are missing since Trent Alexander-Arnold's departure.

item.title: 'You dream of the World Cup' - new Sweden boss Potter
item.description: Graham Potter says having the chance to help Sweden reach the World Cup is "incredibly exciting" after being announced as their head coach on an initial short-term basis.

item.title: Arbroath stun St Johnstone & other SPFL highlights
item.description: Watch goals from the Championship, League One and League Two in Scotland, including Arbroath stunning St Johnstone and a magnificent Stranraer free-kick.

item.title: Allowing Mbeumo goal to stand was tough decision but right one - Given
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given says that referee Michael Oliver made the right decision to allow Bryan Mbeumo's goal to stand in Manchester United's 2-1 win over Liverpool in the Premier League.

item.title: 'It's ego' - top-heavy recruitment has left Liverpool 'disjointed'
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Troy Deeney discusses why Liverpool's summer recruitment has led to them becoming "disjointed" in their run of four straight defeats in all competitions.

item.title: Villa fight back to win at Tottenham
item.description: Aston Villa fight back from a goal down to beat Spurs 2-1 at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

item.title: If you lose four times in a row you need to be concerned - Slot
item.description: Arne Slot says he is concerned about Liverpool's recent run of results after they suffered their fourth loss in a row with a 2-1 defeat by Manchester United.

item.title: Man Utd spirit decisive - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim says his side's "great spirit" was the decisive factor in their 2-1 win against Liverpool at Anfield.

item.title: Haaland's football intelligence makes him 'unplayable' - Richards
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Micah Richards and Alan Shearer look at how Erling Haaland is currently "unplayable" after the striker scored two goals for Manchester City in their win over Everton.

item.title: Mateta is a 'nightmare' for defenders - Shearer
item.description: Match of the Day's Alan Shearer breaks down Jean-Philippe Mateta's movement and what makes him so difficult to defend against following the striker's hat-trick against Bournemouth in the Premier League.

item.title: Postecoglou only getting five games is 'ridiculous' - analysis
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Micah Richards and Alan Shearer say it was "ridiculous" for Nottingham Forest owner Evangelos Marinakis to sack manager Ange Postecoglou after just 39 days in the job.

item.title: Tottenham 'aggressive and intense' but not enough - Frank
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur manager Thomas Frank says his side came out "aggressive and intense" but it was not enough to counter Aston Villa's finishing during a 2-1 defeat.

item.title: 'Managing a lot of Premier League teams like a holiday compared to Celtic'
item.description: Brendan Rodgers sits down with Kelly Somers to discuss his managerial career, proudest moment and joining the 1,000 club.

item.title: Football, fashion & the rise of the replica shirt
item.description: How football shirts have evolved from one kit per club per season, with simple designs, to fashion statements.

item.title: 'Shout out to my ex' - why clubs are turning to former bosses
item.description: With three clubs bringing back old bosses this season already, BBC Sport looks at the teams and managers who have got back together.

item.title: Why Caicedo is pivotal for Chelsea - but are they over-reliant?
item.description: The 23-year-old midfielder has three goals this season, including his powerful strike against Liverpool, entering the debate as being among the best in the league.

item.title: 'Another celebrity boss? No, I've earned my chance'
item.description: Forest Green boss Robbie Savage insists he is no "celebrity manager" after guiding his new side to a dream start, including a spot in the FA Cup first round.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What is the manager VAR card being trialled by Fifa?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at how the Football Video Support system works.

item.title: What does squad-cost ratio and anchoring mean in football?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what squad-cost ratio and anchoring mean.

item.title: Why do Australia play in Asia and not Oceania?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why the Socceroos play in the Asian Football Confederation and the Asian Cup.

item.title: England are going to the 2026 World Cup - who else has qualified?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who has qualified for next year's Fifa World Cup.

item.title: When is the FA Cup first round?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explains when the FA Cup first-round takes place and what the fixtures are.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: 'A proud club dragged into gutter'
item.description: Kevin Muscat is the latest to be ruled out of Rangers' manager search - so what do fans make of the process, and who do they want now?

item.title: Could the first international football stadium become flats?
item.description: The first Hampden Park in Glasgow's Southside is currently the home of a bowling club facing financial difficulties.

item.title: Why can Hearts 'enjoy build-up' to Celtic showdown?
item.description: Heart of Midlothian have stretched their lead at the top of the Scottish Premiership, but how are they placed as they prepare to take on champions Celtic next time out?

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: 'With service, Hojlund is a 25-goals-a-year striker'
item.description: Peter Schmeichel criticises the decision-making at Manchester United that has allowed Rasmus Hojlund to follow Scott McTominay to Napoli.

item.title: Agyemang joins Premier League stars on Golden award shortlists
item.description: England striker Michelle Agyemang is nominated for Golden Girl, while nine Premier League players are named on the shortlist for the Golden Boy award.

item.title: Top European clubs discuss using six substitutes
item.description: Europe's top clubs, including some Premier League sides, have held discussions about using six substitutes per game to ease the workload on players.

item.title: Overseas game a 'sacrifice' for 'survival' of Serie A - Como
item.description: Italian club Como say "sacrifice is essential" to ensure the "survival" of Serie A amid the financial dominance of the Premier League as they press ahead with plans to play AC Milan in Perth, Australia.

item.title: Three players, 57 goals - who is the best striker?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the goalscoring exploits of Harry Kane, Kylian Mbappe and Erling Haaland, who are all averaging more than a goal a game.

item.title: 'He's giving us a lot of joy' - Rashford's revival at Barcelona
item.description: Marcus Rashford came to Barcelona to revive a spluttering career, and so far he is making a good job of that task, but it remains early days in Spain for the England forward.

item.title: A long-range stunner and Rolfo's first for Man Utd - WCL goals of the week
item.description: Chelsea's Johanna Rytting Kaneryd and Manchester United's Fridolina Rolfo shine in week two of the league phase of the Women's Champions League.

item.title: Hundreds attend ex-Liverpool manager Beard's funeral
item.description: The great and good of women's football are among those saying an emotional farewell to Matt Beard.

item.title: Arsenal goalkeeper Zinsberger suffers ACL injury
item.description: Arsenal goalkeeper Manuela Zinsberger is expected to miss the rest of the season after suffering a ruptured anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury.

item.title: Northern Ireland captain Magill out of play-off
item.description: Northern Ireland captain Simone Magill is one of several absentees for the Nations League promotion play-off with Iceland.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
